intro: Chaetolepis citrina, commonly known as the yellow star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant has strap-like, evergreen leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
